message.content:
{"id": "17618", "title": "Bug 17618: Changing output location does not delete all derived resources", "description": "When changing the output folder of a project, all derived resources are not being deleted. This issue only occurs when the derived resources have been created by the Java builder.", "OB": "When changing the output folder of a project, all derived resources should be deleted.", "EB": "After changing the output folder to project/bin and then changing it back to the project folder, the class files are deleted, but the resources are still present in the project/bin folder.", "SR": "Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a project with auto-build enabled.
2) Import Java sources and resources.
3) Change the output folder to project/bin.
4) All class files are removed (as expected).
5) Change the output folder back to the project.
6) All class files are removed (as expected), but the resources are still present in the project/bin folder.

Note: When opening the properties dialog for one of these resources, it is tagged as 'Derived'."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '17618', 'title': 'Bug 17618Changing output location should delete all derived resources', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Bug 17618Changing output location should delete all derived resources Thus, it should be possible to remove all derived resources aslong as they have been created by the Java builder. ', 'SR': 'F11) create a project (autobuild on)2) import Java sources and resources3) change output folder to project/binall class files are removed (fine)4) change output folder back to be the project all class files are removed (fine)5) open project/bin all resources are still thereNote: When opening the properties dialog on such a resource it is taggedas "Derived". '}
